thread.title_full: Pit Bull Rescued From 'Crack House' Becomes FDNY Firehouse Dog | Cubby And Carolina In The Morning | 103.5 KTU

title: Pit Bull Rescued From 'Crack House' Becomes FDNY Firehouse Dog | Cubby And Carolina In The Morning | 103.5 KTU
text:
share 
Animal rescuers Erica Mahnken and her fiance, Michael Favor found an abandoned Pit Bull from a 'crack house' in Staten Island. The dog was malnourished and covered in cigarette burns. UGH! Horrible! Hero's Erica and Michael didn't have anywhere to take the dog so they called up the Lower East Side FDNY, FORT PITT and asked if they would welcome the dog, at least temporarily. They used to house a Rottweiler, so they knew the firehouse was dog friendly! A few days later the firehouse called up Erica and Michael and told them they wanted to permanently adopt the dog, who they renamed from Ashley to ASH! He is now the official Firehouse dog. She has such an amazing life now thanks to her rescuers and the FDNY!! A post shared by Ashley (@probyash) on Feb 17, 2017 at 12:43pm PST ON AIR: Weekdays 6AM-10AM Tune in each and every weekday from 6am - 10am for The Cubby And Carolina Morning Show!Brainbuster - 6amBattle Of The Sexes – 8:15amCelebrity Spin with Carolina Bermudez – 6:05am, 7:05am, 8:05amFeel Good News: 7am, 8am, 9amTBT Mini Mix With Prostyle – Thursday's at 8:30am Contact
